comment.narrative: At the start of the strategic partnership there was no report or parts of it
The goal is to have the report completed by the 1st of October; for this period that means that about one third should be completed

title.narrative: SP Total - Intermediate Outcome: Effects of PILA

description.narrative: Increased capacity to influence (L+A) on SP issues, claims and policy goals.

title.narrative: # of partnering stakeholders included by alliance; INDICATOR 6: (DD6)

comment.narrative: Q2: In response to economic impact of COVID-19 on workers (because of layoff, unpaid leave and being jobless), partner established a task force who focus on distribution of basic need packages (rice, sugar, etc) for members, doing advocacy, fund raising, media and research. 2164 packages distriubuted in Q2 to members as well as peoples around secretariat, oldest and children.

title.narrative: # of evidence produced by alliance partners in support of lobby and advocacy on SP issues, claims and policy goals; INDICATOR 8

comment.narrative: Indicator 8.2 # of best practices submitted: Decent Work Check Survey 2020 was modified into COVID-19 Factory Survey 2020. Data on COVID-19 factory survey and factory pages are highly used in all Data Academy training. All the argumentation are being build based on the data from the website ·COVID-19 factory Survey data is also being used in national advocacy as a research brief based on policy/recomendation that trade union and Data Academy team propose for the national govenment and institution. First audiences is to OMBUDSMAN and have positive responce which Ombudsman will facilitate a meeting between TU and Ministry of Manpower, Ministry of Economic Affairs, and Ministry of Industry to accomodate TU recommentions: Labour Inspector to enhance their labour inspection especially health protocols during COVID-19 pandemic

title.narrative: # of partners (trade unions or CSOs) with increased PILA capacities # of partnering stakeholders included by alliance; INDICATOR 5: (DD5)
# of advocacy and policy champions promoting evidence base and influencing targeted policy and decision-makers; INDICATOR 7:

comment.narrative: Indicator 7.1 # of advocates participating in capacity building: Q3: 4 online trainings on GbV, with 82 female participants Q4: 38 women trained on using data/evidence base to negotiate with management, and 60% are potential woman trade union leader in lower level. Indicator 7.3: # of advocates (factories, suppliers) actively promoting SP issues Q2: (1) Partner carried out the factory and workers survey online. (2) Continue preparation the second online training on the module of academy study on the right garment workers; Q3: Partner conducted (1) training through e-learning videos for workers in Serang and Sukabumi (2) offline training in Jakarta and Banten with attendance of only 50% of the total target. Total participants who attended these training in 4 locations are about 84 workers consist of 46 male, 38 female. Another partner held 12 online discussions on women laborers (NGOBRAS) that still continue once a week every Saturday, and the themes discussed are Labor, Women and COVID-19. Total, there were around 7200 (all) women workers (@ 600 unique viewers) joint the discussion through platform Facebook. All of these online discussions have been documented on the YouTube platform.

description.narrative: Increased engagement of civil society, business and government on SP advocacy issues, claims and policy goals.

title.narrative: # of (re)presentations in policy dialogue on SP issues, claims or policy goals INDICATOR 3: (DD3)

comment.narrative: Q1:(1) Partner discussed 5 times with Ministry of Women and Child Protection fot Daycare facility at Industrial Zone. (2) Partner went 1 times to Daycare facility (3) Partner meeting with Management of Industrial Zone to discuss on Covid-19 issue impacted to workers; Q3: Partner continued advocacy and lobbying with companies and the Ministry of Women and Children Empowerment; Q4: Participants trained in the Data Academy were able to negotiate labour conditions in 14 factories, covering over 27 thousand workers

title.narrative: Indicator 4: (DD4) # of advocacy initiatives carried out by partners and key stakeholders for, by or with their membership/constituency

comment.narrative: Partner networking with food security oriented NGOs in Central Java
